Quote: “Look. I might be blind, but I know that you’ve been out there all morning. Why aren’t you in your hollows sleeping?”
Speaker: Octavia

Quote: “Oh, and now Otulissa! What are you doing here?”
Speaker: Octavia

Quote: “Waiting for Soren to come out. He’s been in there reading for days now!”
Speaker: Otulissa

Quote: “We want to hear the legends, too. We want to read them with you.”
Speaker: Otulissa

Quote: “I thought it was just going to be us? How did she horn in on it?”
Speaker: Gylfie

Quote: “I am the one responsible for teaching the legends and the cantos to the young’uns here at the tree. I am the ryb for Ga’Hoology, which includes the natural history of the tree and its owl history.”
Speaker: Otulissa

Quote: “I think you should hear the legends, Otulissa…”
Speaker: Coryn

Quote: “And you as well. It is only fitting. But let me warn you that there is strong stuff in these legends. There are truths that will make your gizzards quake.”
Speaker: Coryn

Quote: “Would it be possible to end night flight early and begin reading the second legend then?”
Speaker: Coryn

Quote: “Yes, we shall end early, and Soren will meet with you first to tell you what we learned in the first legend before we read the second.”
Speaker: Coryn

Quote: “Before I begin I should tell you that neither Coryn nor myself is sure who wrote this second volume of the legends.”
Speaker: Soren

Quote: “All right, milady. Save yourself and save your young’un. Join us. You can be my consort, my queen, the queen of nachtmagen.”
Speaker: Lord Arrin

Quote: “I am already a queen. Queen of the N’yrthghar. I need no other court, no other kingdom.”
Speaker: Siv

Quote: “I ask you again, milady. Has the egg hatched yet?”
Speaker: Lord Arrin
The text does not provide information on who said "prince."

Quote: “The worms! Theo, do we have the worms?”
Speaker: Grank

Quote: “First worm, Hoole, this is your First Worm ceremony. May Glaux bless you and make your gizzard strong.”
Speaker: Grank

Quote: “The lad’s a natural, an absolute natural.”
Speaker: Grank

Quote: “Can you fetch us another field mouse?”
Speaker: Grank

Quote: “Maybe I’ll try for a vole, Grank. That might fill him up.”
Speaker: Theo

Quote: “Oh, a vole! A vole! I want a vole!”
Speaker: Hoole

Quote: “Theo, will you really get me a vole?”
Speaker: Hoole

Quote: “We don’t want you taking a tumble off this branch. Your down won’t work for flying.”
Speaker: Grank

Quote: “When will my first flight feathers come in, Uncle Grank?”
Speaker: Hoole

Quote: “Not until your fluff falls out. Your first molt.”
Speaker: Grank

Quote: “Maybe not, Uncle Grank. Take a look please, please!”
Speaker: Hoole

Quote: “All right, now wave good-bye to Theo.”
Speaker: Grank

Quote: “Bye, Theo! Uncle Grank’s going to see if I’ve started to budge. Maybe by the time you get back I will have a flight feather.”
Speaker: Hoole
